fmod.node.getindexat.title.name: Get Object At Index
fmod.node.getindexat.title.feat: Get an object at a specific index in a list.
fmod.node.getindexat.input.list.name: List
fmod.node.getindexat.input.list.feat: The list to get the object from.
fmod.node.getindexat.input.index.name: Index
fmod.node.getindexat.input.index.feat: The index of the object to get, starting from 0. Negative values count from the end.
fmod.node.getindexat.input.name.name: Name
fmod.node.getindexat.input.name.feat: Optional variable name to store the result.
fmod.node.getindexat.output.object.name: Object
fmod.node.getindexat.output.object.feat: The object at the specified index.
fmod.node.getindexat.output.size.name: Size
fmod.node.getindexat.output.size.feat: The number of elements in the list.
fmod.node.setindexat.title.name: Set Object At Index
fmod.node.setindexat.title.feat: Set an object at a specific index in a list.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.list.name: List
fmod.node.setindexat.input.list.feat: The list to set the object in.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.index.name: Index
fmod.node.setindexat.input.index.feat: The index to set the object at, starting from 0. Negative values count from the end.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.object.name: Object
fmod.node.setindexat.input.object.feat: The object to set at the specified index.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.replace.name: Replace
fmod.node.setindexat.input.replace.feat: If true, replace the element at the index. If false, insert and shift existing elements. Treat null as true.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.flatten.name: Flatten
fmod.node.setindexat.input.flatten.feat: If true and Object is a list, expand its elements. If false, treat Object as a single element. Treat null as true.
fmod.node.setindexat.input.strip.name: Strip
fmod.node.setindexat.input.strip.feat: If true, remove null values from the beginning and end of the result. Treat null as true.
fmod.node.setindexat.output.list.name: List
fmod.node.setindexat.output.list.feat: The list after setting the object.
fmod.node.setindexat.output.object.name: Affected
fmod.node.setindexat.output.object.feat: The original object at the specified index before modification.
fmod.node.setindexat.output.sizebefore.f: The number of elements in the list before setting the object.
fmod.node.setindexat.output.sizeafter.fe: The number of elements in the list after setting the object.
fmod.node.setindexat.error.oom: The list is too large and there is not enough memory to set the object at the specified index.

fmod.node.addvarflow.output.name: Variable Count
fmod.node.addvarflow.output.feat: The total number of variables in the target flow after adding.

fmod.node.trigger.output.param.name: Parameter
fmod.node.trigger.output.param.feat: Optional parameter provided by the player.
fmod.node.error.inputnull: Input %2$s of Node %1$s cannot be null.
fmod.node.error.classcast: Cannot cast the type of input %2$s in node %1$s to %3$s
fmod.options.title: F Minecraft Mod Options
fmod.options.tip: You can also use command /f options to change these options.
fmod.options.hint.translate:
If enabled, the server will translate all the messages before sending them to the client.
This is useful if only the server has this mod installed and the client does not have it.
But if enabled, the message will not follow the client's language setting.
§cThis option will not work on the client side.
§rDefault: §cON
fmod.options.hint.flowlength:
The maximum number of nodes that can be executed in a single flow execution.
This is designed to prevent infinite loops during flow executions.
Default: §d32767
fmod.options.hint.flowrecursion:
The maximum number of recursive calls allowed in a single flow execution.
This is designed to prevent infinite recursion during flow executions.
§cWarning: Setting this value too high may cause the game to crash or even corrupt your save. Do not modify this option unless you know what you are doing!§r
Default: §d16
fmod.options.hint.flowhistory:
The number of past flow executions to keep in history for debugging purposes.
Keeping more history may consume more memory.
Default: §d32767
fmod.options.hint.entitydeath:
When a non-hostile and non-passive entity dies, the death message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.hostiledeath:
When a hostile entity dies, the death message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.passivedeath:
When a passive entity dies, the death message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.bossdeath:
When a boss dies, the death message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.nameddeath:
When an entity with a custom name dies, the death message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.killerdeath:
When a killer dies, the death message to be shown.
If an entity has killed a player before, it will be recognized as a killer.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.bosshealth:
If an entity's max health is greater than this value, it will be recognized as a boss.
Default: §d150
fmod.options.hint.cansleep:
When it is the time to sleep or the time to wake up, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.deathcoord:
When a player dies, the message containing the death location coordinates to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.hitothers:
When a projectile thrown by a player hits an entity, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.beinghit:
When a projectile hits a player, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.informafk:
When a player is suspected to be afking, the message to be shown until he is back.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.afkthres:
If a player did not change his sight direction after this time, he will be suspected to be afking.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d60
fmod.options.hint.bcafk:
When a player is confirmed afking, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.bcafkthres:
If a player did not change his sight direction after this time, he will be confirmed afking.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d300
fmod.options.hint.stopafk:
When a player is back from afking, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.changebiome:
When a player enters a new biome, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.biomedelay:
How long after a player enters a new biome before showing the change biome message.
This is designed to avoid a player frequently cross the boundary of two biomes to spam actionbar messages.
Default: §d10
fmod.options.hint.bossfight:
When a player attacks a boss, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.bossfightinterval:
After how long showing the last boss fight message before showing the next one.
If you have already set the boss fight message to chat, please increase this value to avoid spamming messages.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d60
fmod.options.hint.monstersurround:
When a player is surrounded by monsters, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.monsterinterval:
After how long showing the last surrounded by monster message before showing the next one.
If you have already set the surrounded by monster message to chat, please increase this value to avoid spamming messages.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d60
fmod.options.hint.monsternumber:
If the number of monsters near a player is greater than this value, that player will be recognized as surrounded by monsters.
Default: §d8
fmod.options.hint.monsterdistance:
If the Chebyshev distance between a player and a monster is less than this value, that monster will be recognized as near the player.
Unit: meters
Default: §d12
fmod.options.hint.entitywarning:
When the number of entities in the world is greater than the threshold, the warning message to be shown.
Disabling this option §cdoes NOT§r completely disable the detection behavior.
To completely disable the detection behavior, set Entity Number Check Interval to a sufficiently large value.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.densitywarning:
When the density of entities in a certain area is too high, the warning message to be shown.
Disabling this option §cdoes NOT§r completely disable the detection behavior.
To completely disable the detection behavior, set Entity Density Check Interval to a sufficiently large value.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.entitynumber:
If the number of entities in the world is greater than this value, the warning message will be shown.
This is designed to inform players to avoid too many entities lagging the server.
Default: §d3000
fmod.options.hint.entitydensity:
When the number of entities exceeds this value, the calculation of the most densely populated area of entities will automatically start.
This feature is designed to help players find possible reasons for too many entities.
Default: §d3000
fmod.options.hint.densitynumber:
When calculating the most densely populated area of entities, the minimum number of entities contained in the candidate area.
Default: §d100
fmod.options.hint.densityradius:
When calculating the most densely populated area of entities, the minimum radius of the candidate area.
Unit: meters
Default: §d8
fmod.options.hint.entityinterval:
How often to check the number of entities in the world.
Frequently checking the number of the entities may cause lag.
You can set this value to exceed the maximum supported by the slider using the /f options entityNumberCheckInterval command.
Unit: ticks
Default: §d20
fmod.options.hint.densityinterval:
How often to check the density of entities.
Calculating entity density is very performance-intensive, and checking too frequently can cause severe server lag.
You can set this value to exceed the maximum supported by the slider using the /f options entityDensityCheckInterval command.
Unit: ticks
Default: §d20
fmod.options.hint.playerhurt:
When a player is seriously hurt, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.damagethres:
If the damage dealt to a player is greater than this percentage of his max health, that player will be recognized as seriously hurt.
Default: §d80%
fmod.options.hint.travelmessage:
When a player travels a long distance quickly, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.travelinterval:
How often to send a message when a player travels a long distance quickly.
If you have set the message to be shown in the chat bar, please increase this value to avoid spamming.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d1
fmod.options.hint.travelwindow:
How many ticks of positions to track for long-distance travel detection.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d30
fmod.options.hint.traveltotal:
Required horizontal distance between the oldest and newest tracked positions to trigger.
Unit: meters
Default: §d100
fmod.options.hint.travelcheck:
Interval in ticks between partial distance checks inside the travel window.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d10
fmod.options.hint.travelpartial:
Minimum horizontal distance between two positions separated by the partial interval to count as continuous travel.
Unit: meters
Default: §d40
fmod.options.hint.teleportthres:
If any single-tick horizontal movement exceeds this distance, the player will be considered to have teleported.
Unit: meters
Default: §d75
fmod.options.hint.teleport:
When a player teleports, the message to be shown.
Default: §cOFF
fmod.options.hint.gpturl:
The URL of the target GPT server when executing command /f gpt.
This mod will use the OpenAI API. So if you want to deploy a local large language model, you must make sure it is compatible with the OpenAI API.
Default: §3"http://127.0.0.1:12345/v1/chat/completions"
fmod.options.hint.gptkey:
The access tokens of the GPT server.
If the sever does not need an access token, leave it blank.
Default: §3""
fmod.options.gptkey.noedit: §cFor security reasons, you cannot edit the access tokens here. If you need to modify it, please use the command /f options gptAccessTokens.
fmod.options.hint.gptmodel:
The model to use when executing command /f gpt.
If the sever does not need to choose a model, leave it blank.
Default: §3""
fmod.options.hint.gptprompt:
The system prompts of GPT, at the beginning of all the conversations.
Default: §3""
fmod.options.hint.gpttemperature:
The temperature parameter of GPT.
Default: §d0.8
fmod.options.hint.gpttimeout:
The timeout when getting response from the GPT server.
Unit: seconds
Default: §d60
fmod.options.message.main: The display method of the message received by players who meet the conditions.
fmod.options.message.other: The display method of the message received by players who do not meet the conditions.
fmod.options.message.receiver: Message receiver. Players who meet the conditions will receive the main message, while other players will receive the secondary message.
